news.headline: DemokratieKioske Project Launches February 2026
news.summary: Lust auf besser leben gGmbH launched the DemokratieKioske project, a democracy engagement initiative running from February to September 2026. The project includes 30 Young Urban Future Labs in youth institutions (February-May) and 11 artistically redesigned kiosks across the Rhine-Main region hosting approximately 120 events (May-September). Funded by Hessische Landeszentrale für politische Bildung, Deutsche Fernsehlotterie, and Kultur-Fonds Frankfurt RheinMain.

news.headline: Bark Date event scheduled at Kiessee
news.summary: A Bark Date event was scheduled for January 31, 2026, from 11:00 to 13:00 at Wiese an der Westseite des Kiessees, featuring dogs from STREUNERHerzen animal welfare organization.

news.headline: Eintracht Frankfurt Partnership Discussions
news.summary: Daniela and Marlene from Lust auf besser leben gGmbH conducted partnership discussions with Eintracht Frankfurt last week as part of 2026 initiatives. The organization described the meetings as productive collaborative sessions.

news.headline: Crunchbase profiles BEEsharing in bee-based startups article
news.summary: Crunchbase News mentions BEEsharing.io as a Hamburg-based pollination brokerage network in a recent article on bee startups. It describes the platform connecting farmers, beekeepers, and vendors while handling logistics. Published within the last 30 days amid strong funding trends in the sector.

news.headline: Lendorse secures €10M debt capital line from Swiss i2 Group
news.summary: Munich-based Lendorse obtained a €10 million debt capital line from Swiss i2 Group to expand its Income Share Agreement business for international STEM students. The funding supports scaling student loans after prior €200K from Techstars, Vealo Ventures, and Earlybird. Founders are Björn Wolf and Evgenii Avdeev.

news.headline: ISB RLP invests in Nexol Photovolthermic AG
news.summary: ISB RLP (Investitions- und Strukturbank Rheinland-Pfalz), a German development bank, announced participation in Nexol Photovolthermic AG. This represents a concrete funding/investment event for the solar water heater startup.

news.headline: Zukunft Fahrrad und Radeln ohne Alter starten Kooperation
news.summary: Zukunft Fahrrad, Bundesverband der innovativen Fahrradwirtschaft, und Radeln ohne Alter Deutschland e.V. sind eine Kooperation eingegangen. Gemeinsam setzen sie sich für inklusive, nachhaltige Mobilität für alle Altersstufen und lebenswerte Städte ein.

news.headline: RoA Pocking erreicht über 80 Fördermitglieder
news.summary: Radeln ohne Alter Pocking wächst weiter mit über 80 Fördermitgliedern, mehr als die Hälfte sind geschulte Rikscha-Piloten. Die Flotte ermöglicht regelmäßige Fahrten für Senioren und Menschen mit Behinderungen.

news.headline: Takasago & Wachswandel win Social Entrepreneur Award Kreis Euskirchen 2025
news.summary: Takasago and Wachswandel received the Social Entrepreneur Award Kreis Euskirchen 2025 at a ceremonial event in the Ideenfabrik Nachhaltige Wirtschaft. The award recognizes their social entrepreneurial efforts in the Euskirchen district.

news.headline: Fainin receives fast track tickets and legal advice at Zebra Investment Night
news.summary: Fainin, a platform for renting rarely used items, participated in the premiere Zebra Investment Night by Impact Hub Hamburg. While other startups secured funding commitments, Fainin received legal advice and fast track tickets for further investor meetings. This event marked a successful debut with total funding commitments of 135,000 euros to four startups.

news.headline: Queermentor Role Model Awards 2026: 25 queer people and allies awarded in Berlin
news.summary: Queermentor awarded 25 queer individuals and allies, including Riccardo Simonetti and Armin Morbach, at the Role Model Awards 2026 held in Berlin. The event recognizes contributions to visibility, equal opportunities, and LGBTQIA+ empowerment in the workplace and society. This is the second edition following the first in January 2025.

news.headline: Bark Date event held in Ellwangen (Jagst)
news.summary: Bark Date organized a dog adoption event in Ellwangen on January 25, 2026, featuring up to 30 dogs from animal welfare organizations. Visitors could meet dogs wearing red bandanas marked 'adopt me' and schedule follow-up appointments for adoption discussions.

news.headline: AI.Land participates in Grüne Woche Berlin, present in two halls
news.summary: AI.Land is exhibiting at the 100th Grüne Woche in Berlin from January 16-25, 2026, showcasing agrarrobots Aplamo and DAVEGI in Halle 23 and NRW-Halle. The event highlights traditional vegetable farming revolutionized by robotics.

news.headline: BEEsharing participates in EIB Fado pitching challenge
news.summary: BEEsharing.io featured in the European Investment Bank's Fado pitching challenge. The event highlights the startup's pitch among innovative companies. This recognition underscores their role in agriculture and pollination innovation.

news.headline: biosafety4u.berlin GmbH and Cellcolab GmbH announce cooperation
news.summary: biosafety4u.berlin GmbH and Cellcolab GmbH announced a joint cooperation to support biotech startups with flexible lab spaces and regulatory services. The partnership provides one-stop-shop solutions for on-demand labs, equipment, and biosafety compliance to accelerate research. Cellcolab plans expansion to Berlin.

news.headline: Duni Group and Relevo launch ReMuc reusable container initiative in Munich
news.summary: Duni Group and Relevo by Duni launched the five-year ReMuc – 'Ois im Kreis' project at Munich's Viktualienmarkt, featuring automated return stations for reusable food containers. Relevo manages deposits, returns, and traceability digitally. Partners include Recup, Circle Cube, and Cup Company, aiming to reduce waste ahead of EU PPWR regulations.

news.headline: Duni Group partners with Relevo for Munich reusable food container system
news.summary: Duni Group partnered with majority-owned Relevo to trial a digital reusable container system at Viktualienmarkt over five years, installing five automated stations. The initiative promotes scalable reuse to cut packaging waste and vendor burdens. It aligns with upcoming EU Packaging and Packaging Waste Regulation.

news.headline: hellgrün Energie secures €1M growth capital from Saxovent
news.summary: Cologne-based hellgrün Energie GmbH raised 1 million euros in growth financing from Saxovent Smart Eco Investments GmbH to accelerate rollout of onsite PV solutions for commercial real estate in retail and logistics. The funding supports scaling decarbonization efforts without owners becoming energy suppliers. hellgrün plans over 100 MW capacity by 2027.

news.headline: hellgrün Energie gets Wachstumskapital from Saxovent
news.summary: hellgrün Energie received 1 million euros growth financing from Saxovent to expand PV pipeline for commercial properties including retail, logistics, and manufacturing. Supported by angel investors like Tobias Dollberg, the funding targets scalable decarbonization of rooftops.

news.headline: Saxovent expands stake in hellgrün Energie with growth capital
news.summary: Saxovent increased its investment in hellgrün Energie, providing additional growth capital and becoming the second-largest shareholder after founders. The funding enables scaling of PV projects on commercial real estate.

news.headline: r3leaf participates in HTWK Leipzig startup event at CCL
news.summary: r3leaf, with HTWK alumnus Tore Waldhausen, is featured among startups at a research conference on January 20, 2026, at Congress Center Leipzig. The event highlights innovative projects from the university. This marks public recognition of the company's involvement in the local tech ecosystem.

news.headline: Radeln ohne Alter e.V. startet Aktivitäten in Bonn
news.summary: Radeln ohne Alter e.V. wird nun auch in Bonn aktiv mit Rikscha-Fahrten für Menschen mit eingeschränkter Mobilität.

news.headline: Lufthansa Industry Solutions partners with SPRK.global on food waste platform
news.summary: Lufthansa Industry Solutions is supporting the Berlin-based greentech startup SPRK.global in developing a global digital trading platform to prevent food surpluses and promote resource conservation. This strategic cooperation aims to build technology for reducing food waste in the supply chain. The partnership is highlighted in LHIND's recent news overview.

news.headline: Gelzhäuser Forst siblings win Waldpreis award for forestry innovation
news.summary: Lisa and Timo Gelzhäuser from Gelzhäuser Forst in Kierspe received the Waldpreis, awarded in Berlin, for innovative forestry practices after climate damage and bark beetle infestations forced them to pivot to building and selling Tiny Houses from affected wood. The award highlights their efforts in reforestation, biodiversity, and direct wood marketing. They plan to invest the 2000 Euro prize in reforestation information.

news.headline: Manifesta 16 Ruhr and lala.ruhr to host market event at St. Josef church
news.summary: Manifesta 16 Ruhr and lala.ruhr will transform the former St. Josef church in Gelsenkirchen into a market on February 28, 2026. They are seeking creators from the Ruhr Area for projects in upcycled crafts, handmade design, and visual arts. This is part of the pre-biennial warm-up programme.

news.headline: DBU awards Nunos GmbH 125,000 Euro grant for odorless manure fertilizer tech
news.summary: The Deutsche Bundesstiftung Umwelt (DBU) is funding startup Nunos from Hürth with 125,000 Euros to develop a biological process converting manure into efficient, odorless fertilizer. The technology, spun out from DLR space research, reduces greenhouse gas emissions and improves nutrient availability, with field trials planned for 2026. Co-founder Tim Paulke highlighted up to 20% yield increases expected.

news.headline: eco:fibr announces next operational milestone for toll production in 2026
news.summary: eco:fibr shared a blog post on their next operational milestone for toll production targeting 2026. This aligns with their crowdinvesting campaign to fund ton-scale production and market entry at the start of 2026. The update highlights progress toward pilot production.

news.headline: meine ernte launches new products at Hornbach
news.summary: meine ernte expanded its product portfolio with new offerings specifically designed for plant cultivation. The company started an exclusive cooperation with Hornbach to expand the range of nature-based gardening products.

news.headline: Munevo raises €3M for US expansion
news.summary: Munevo GmbH completed a €3 million financing round from Bavaria Capital, BayBG, Be10x Capital, Roca X, and other investors. The funds will support US market expansion, sales network growth, and European partnerships. CEO Claudiu Leverenz highlighted the impact on helping more people with head-controlled wheelchairs.

news.headline: Cozero raises €6.5M in Series A funding
news.summary: Berlin-based Cozero, a carbon accounting software startup founded in 2020, secured €6.5 million in Series A funding. The investment supports growth in sustainability software for emissions management.

news.headline: Goodgive places 2nd in Rheinland-Pitch Halbfinale Köln Female Founders Edition
news.summary: Goodgive participated in the Rheinland-Pitch Halbfinale Köln Female Founders Edition and secured second place after As Good As Pros. The event, organized with Female Innovation Hub, IHK Köln, and Synnous Consulting, featured pitches to qualify for the summer finale. Goodgive offers eco-friendly reusable fabric gift wrapping.

news.headline: inGemeinschaft wins Gründerpreis from Stadtsparkasse München
news.summary: The Munich startup inGemeinschaft, a platform matching people with spare rooms to students seeking affordable housing, won the Startup category of the Gründerpreis from Stadtsparkasse München. The award recognizes its sustainable intergenerational housing concept that creates new living space without construction and promotes social interaction. The platform offers free profiles, intelligent matching, transparency, and personal support.

news.headline: KEY2BE.ME selected among 12 startups for Lübeck future program
news.summary: KEY2BE.ME was chosen as one of twelve startups in Lübeck to be prepared for the future through a regional program announced by Wirtschaftsminister Dr. Bernd Buchholz. The initiative highlights promising companies from Schleswig-Holstein, including Kiel and Lübeck. KEY2BE.ME develops a career orientation community with online events and a personal guide app.

news.headline: mySHOEFITTER wins jury and audience at Dortmund University Days
news.summary: mySHOEFITTER from Hamm most convinced the jury and audience with their presentation at the Dortmund University Days in January 2026. The event featured various short announcements and notes. This recognition highlights the startup's appeal in a competitive university setting.

news.headline: Nevalu's pop-up store project wins Marketing Prize Münster-Osnabrück
news.summary: The project 'P41 | REACH goes Prinzipalmarkt x Nevalu' received the Marketing Prize from Marketing Club Münster-Osnabrück for innovative marketing connecting education, innovation, science, and retail. The 6-week pop-up store attracted over 26,000 visitors and highlighted sustainability, recycling, and innovation. It was a collaboration with REACH EUREGIO and P41 initiator Tobias Viehoff.

news.headline: fobizz acquires Stuttgart-based edtech startup to teach
news.summary: Hamburg-based edtech startup fobizz has taken over to teach from Stuttgart, making it a subsidiary of 101 skills GmbH. Founders Felix Weiß and Marius Lindenmeier remain managing directors. The merger integrates to teach's AI tools for personalized teaching materials into fobizz's platform, reaching more teachers globally.

news.headline: eeden closes €18M Series A funding round led by Forbion
news.summary: German startup eeden, based in Münster, completed an €18M Series A funding round led by Forbion's BioEconomy Fund, with participation from new investors Henkel Ventures and NRW.Venture, plus existing backers like HTGF and TechVision Fund. The funds will build a demonstration plant in Münster, optimize large-scale textile recycling processing, and launch commercial projects with industry partners. This follows successful pilot plant validation.

news.headline: Nexol launches NEX RS series hybrid solar water heater
news.summary: Nexol Photovolthermic released the NEX RS series, a new hybrid solar water heater for residential applications available in four sizes (80-300 liters) with 1.5 kW heating output. The plug-and-play system starts at €700 and represents a major product expansion beyond previous offerings.

news.headline: Mental Hub wins 3rd place in Campus Competition Cologne C3 2025
news.summary: Mental Hub secured third place in the C3 2025 pitch finale at InnoDom Cologne, competing against other Gateway Hochschule Köln startups. The team impressed the jury with their evidence-based peer-support platform developed with research institutions and experts. They are eligible for investment offers from the total 300,000 Euro prize pool.

news.headline: S2S Dynamics participates in Impact Accelerator final pitch in Hamburg
news.summary: S2S Dynamics was one of eight startups that completed the 11-week Impact Accelerator program by Impact Hub Hamburg, focused on sustainability and circular economy. The company presented its AI-powered electronic waste recycling solution at the final pitch event. A jury was impressed, though BuildlinX won for building decarbonization software.

news.headline: SIRPLUS food rescue startup gets rescue and fresh start
news.summary: Berlin-based SIRPLUS relaunches with new partnerships to optimize costs and return to roots. Co-founders expand portfolio to include rescued household items and wellness products from a single Berlin-Weißensee source. Subscription-surprise model continues alongside individual orders.
